intro: Borinda fansipanensis, commonly known as the Fan Mountain borinda, is a flowering plant native to Vietnam. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions. It has a compact growth habit and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
